p: Although its concentration represents only 0.5% that of CO 2, concerns arise regarding a jump in CH 4 atmospheric release. Indeed, it is 30 times more powerful than CO 2 as GHG ( IPCC, 2014). CH 4 generates O 3 (see below), and along with carbon monoxide (CO), contributes to control the amount of OH in the troposphere ( Wuebbles and Hayhoe, 2002).
